ground_truth: As we circle behind them, we look down at Ashton, a tiny town in a tiny valley, where Karl smiles, but then it fades into a certain sad suspicion. Karl thinks for a moment, then they shake on it. In a single shot, Karl cuts his hair with hedge clippers while Edward cuts up a surplus army tent to make him a shirt. Spirits buoyed by the high school marching band, all the good citizens of Ashton are gathered to see off Edward and Karl, with a few tears amid the familiar faces. Edward ducks a bit so the Mayor can put the key around his neck, and the crowd cheers. With that, Edward and Karl start walking, waving as they go, with only Don Price, smoking on the corner, not sad to see Edward leave. Many townsfolk come onto the street to hug Edward or shake his hand. As the crowd parts, he finds himself face to face with an unnamed person. The ruckus slows and quiets, as if a strange spell has been cast, and she motions for Edward to lean down so she can whisper something to him. Although we're very close, we can't hear her voice, and the advice only succeeds in confusing Edward. We tilt up from the road to reveal Edward and Karl walking out of Ashton, each wearing a backpack with all his earthly possessions. Edward and Karl come to a bend where the paved road veers left, and an overgrown dirt road runs straight, blocked with signs and warnings of danger. Karl looks at the dirt road, wary and a little paranoid, but perks up even though it means more for him to carry. The road is overgrown but not altogether creepy, with the sun still shining and the birds still chirping. The road narrows to a rough path, with spikes of sunlight breaking through the thick canopy, catching particles in the air. Coming around a bend, his pitch drops as he sees thick, thorny vines growing across the path, and he stops, realizing for the first time that the birds have stopped singing, and the forest is dead quiet. He looks back the way he came, but Edward presses on, carefully stepping through the thorns. Just then, a cawing crow swoops down and grabs the hat right out of his hands. Edward tosses the sign and forges ahead into the spiderwebs. Edward emerges from the forest, brushing the last cobwebs off and shaking the spiders from his shirt, with one stuck in his sleeve, requiring him to dance to get it out. Even then, he keeps twitching, convinced another one is left behind. At his feet, the gravel road has returned, smooth and dusty and comforting.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: As we rotate behind them, we gaze down at Ashton, a small town in a small valley, where Karl grins, but then it diminishes into a certain gloomy doubt. Karl considers for a moment, then they clasp on it. In a single shot, Karl trims his hair with hedge shears while Edward slices up a surplus army tent to fashion him a shirt. Spirits lifted by the high school marching band, all the good residents of Ashton are gathered to see off Edward and Karl, with a few tears amid the familiar visages. Edward ducks a bit so the Mayor can place the key around his neck, and the crowd applauds. With that, Edward and Karl begin strolling, waving as they go, with only Don Price, smoking on the corner, not unhappy to see Edward depart. Many townsfolk come onto the street to embrace Edward or clasp his hand. As the crowd divides, he discovers himself face to face with an unnamed individual. The commotion slows and quiets, as if a strange enchantment has been cast, and she gestures for Edward to lean down so she can murmur something to him. Although we're very near, we can't hear her voice, and the guidance only succeeds in perplexing Edward. We tilt up from the road to disclose Edward and Karl walking out of Ashton, each wearing a backpack with all his worldly belongings. Edward and Karl arrive at a curve where the paved road deflects left, and an overgrown dirt road runs straight, obstructed with signs and warnings of peril. Karl glances at the dirt road, apprehensive and a little paranoid, but perks up even though it means more for him to bear. The road is overgrown but not altogether eerie, with the sun still shining and the birds still chirping. The road narrows to a rough trail, with rays of sunlight piercing through the thick canopy, catching particles in the atmosphere. Coming around a curve, his pitch drops as he sees thick, thorny vines growing across the trail, and he halts, realizing for the first time that the birds have ceased singing, and the forest is dead silent. He looks back the way he came, but Edward advances on, cautiously stepping through the thorns. Just then, a cawing crow swoops down and snatches the hat right out of his hands. Edward throws aside the sign and presses ahead into the cobwebs. Edward emerges from the forest, brushing the last cobwebs off and shaking the spiders from his shirt, with one stuck in his sleeve, necessitating him to dance to get it out. Even then, he keeps twitching, convinced another one is left behind. At his feet, the gravel road has resumed, smooth and dusty and reassuring.

The way he came is looked back at by him, but Edward presses on, carefully stepping through the thorns. Just then, the hat is grabbed right out of his hands by a cawing crow that swoops down. Edward emerges from the forest, brushing the last cobwebs off and shaking the spiders from his shirt, with one stuck in his sleeve, requiring a dance by him to get it out. test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: As we circle behind them, we see Ashton, a small town in a valley. Karl smiles, then becomes suspicious but shakes on it. Karl uses hedge clippers to cut his hair while Edward turns an army tent into a shirt. Spirits high with the high school marching band, Ashton’s citizens gather to bid Edward and Karl farewell, shedding a few tears. Edward ducks as the Mayor places a key around his neck, and they cheer. Edward and Karl wave as they leave, with only Don Price, smoking on the corner, unsentimental about Edward's departure. Many townsfolk step into the street to hug or shake Edward's hand. As the crowd parts, he encounters an unnamed person who whispers something, leaving Edward confused. We tilt up to see Edward and Karl leaving Ashton, each with a backpack of possessions. At a bend, the paved road veers left, and a dirt road runs straight, marked by danger signs. Karl is wary but perks up, ready to carry more. The overgrown road isn't creepy, with sunlight and chirping birds. The road narrows, sunlight piercing through the canopy. As they round a bend, Karl stops, realizing the birds are silent and the forest is eerily quiet. He looks back, but Edward continues, navigating through thorns. A crow swoops and snatches Edward’s hat. Edward throws the sign away and ventures into the spiderwebs. Emerging from the forest, Edward brushes off cobwebs and shakes spiders from his shirt, dancing to remove one stuck in his sleeve. He continues twitching, fearing one remains. The gravel road reappears, smooth, dusty, and comforting.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Circling behind them, we see Ashton, a small town in a tiny valley. Karl smiles, but suspicion replaces it. They shake on it after Karl thinks for a moment. In one shot, Karl uses hedge clippers to cut his hair, while Edward makes a shirt from an army tent. The high school band lifts spirits; Ashton's citizens gather to bid Edward and Karl farewell with tears. Edward lowers his head for the Mayor to place a key around his neck, prompting cheers. They start walking, waving, with only Don Price indifferent to Edward's departure. Townsfolk hug Edward or shake his hand. Amidst the crowd, Edward meets an unnamed person. Everything quiets as she gestures for Edward to lean down and whisper something, confusing him. We then see Edward and Karl leaving Ashton, each with a backpack. At a bend, the paved road turns left, and a straight, overgrown dirt road warns of danger. Wary, Karl perks up despite carrying more. The sunlit road narrows, with sunlight piercing the canopy. Encountering thorny vines, Karl realizes the forest is silent as the birds stop singing. He hesitates, but Edward moves through the thorns. A crow steals his hat. Edward throws the sign and pushes forward into spiderwebs. Emerging from the forest, Edward brushes off cobwebs and spiders, dancing to remove one from his sleeve, still twitching from imagined ones. The gravel road beneath is smooth, dusty, and comforting.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
As we make a gentle circle behind them, we cast our gaze downward upon Ashton, a diminutive town nestled snugly in a petite valley, where we observe Karl, who is initially smiling, but his expression gradually transforms into a complex blend of suspicion tinged with sadness. Karl ponders these thoughts for a brief moment before he and the other party shake hands on their agreement. In a seamless, singular shot, we witness Karl using hedge clippers to cut his own hair, while simultaneously, Edward is engaged in the task of cutting up a surplus army tent to craft a shirt for him.

Buoyed by the lively spirit of the high school marching band, the good citizens of Ashton, in a heartwarming show of community, come together in a gathering to bid farewell to Edward and Karl, with a few glistening tears visible on the cheeks of the familiar faces. Edward, needing to duck slightly, allows the Mayor to place the ceremonial key around his neck, prompting the crowd to erupt in cheers of appreciation and encouragement. With this gesture completed, Edward and Karl commence their journey, waving goodbye to the town as they depart, with the exception of Don Price, who stands on the corner, puffing on a cigarette and seemingly unfazed by Edward's departure. Numerous townsfolk make their way to the street to exchange hugs with Edward or to shake his hand in fond farewell.

As the assembled crowd gently parts, Edward unexpectedly finds himself face to face with a person whose name we do not know. The bustling commotion gradually slows and quiets, as if under the influence of an enigmatic spell, and she gestures for Edward to lean down, allowing her to whisper something in his ear. Despite our proximity, her words remain inaudible to us, leaving Edward perplexed by the puzzling advice he receives. From our elevated perspective, we look up from the road to see Edward and Karl walking away from Ashton, each carrying a backpack filled with all their worldly belongings. The two travelers arrive at a juncture where the paved road veers to the left, while a dense, overgrown dirt road stretches straight ahead, marked with ominous signs and warnings of potential danger. 

Karl eyes the dirt road with wariness, a hint of paranoia etched on his face, yet his spirits lift, even if it means he must bear more of the burden. Though the road is heavily overgrown, it is not entirely sinister, with the sun still shining brightly and birds continuing to chirp melodiously. As the road narrows to a rough path, beams of sunlight break through the dense canopy above, illuminating particles dancing in the air. Around a bend, his voice drops in pitch as he encounters thick, thorny vines sprawling across the path, prompting him to halt, as he becomes acutely aware that the birds have ceased their song, and an eerie silence envelops the forest. He glances back whence he came, but Edward urges forward, gingerly navigating through the thorny obstacles. In that moment, a cawing crow swoops down, seizing the hat from his grasp. Edward discards the sign and courageously ventures into the spider webs ahead.

Emerging triumphantly from the forest, Edward brushes away the remnants of cobwebs and shakes off the spiders clinging to his shirt, with one stubbornly stuck in his sleeve, necessitating an animated dance to dislodge it. Despite his efforts, he continues to twitch, convinced that yet another spider remains. At his feet, a gravel road welcomes him back, smooth, dusty, and offering a reassuring sense of comfort.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
As we gently maneuver in a circular motion behind the group, our eyes are drawn downward to observe Ashton, a quaint and modest town nestled comfortably within the confines of a petite valley. Here, our attention is captured by Karl, who initially wears a smile, yet his expression gradually shifts into a complex mix of suspicion subtly interwoven with a hint of sadness. Karl contemplates these thoughts for a moment that feels both brief and significant before he and the other party exchange a firm handshake, sealing their agreement. In one fluid, seamless shot, we are privileged to witness Karl taking hedge clippers to trim his own hair, while simultaneously, Edward is deeply engrossed in the task of cutting up an excess army tent in order to fashion a shirt for him.

Filled with the lively spirit and exuberant energy of the high school marching band, the citizens of Ashton, in a heartfelt demonstration of community spirit, gather together to bid a fond farewell to Edward and Karl. A few shimmering tears can be observed glistening on the cheeks of some familiar faces among the crowd. In a symbolic gesture, Edward, needing to lean down slightly, allows the Mayor to place the ceremonial key around his neck, causing the crowd to erupt in a chorus of cheers filled with appreciation, joy, and encouragement. With this symbolic gesture completed, Edward and Karl set off on their journey, waving goodbye to the town's people as they depart, except for Don Price, who stands idly on the corner, nonchalantly puffing away on a cigarette, seemingly unaffected by Edward's departure. Numerous townsfolk gather in the street, eager to share hugs with Edward or to warmly shake his hand in fond farewell.

As the gathered crowd gradually parts, Edward unexpectedly finds himself standing face to face with an individual whose name remains unknown to us. The bustling commotion surrounding them gradually slows and quiets, as if under the influence of an enigmatic spell, and the mysterious person gestures for Edward to lean down. She whispers something into his ear, yet, despite our close proximity, her words remain inaudible, leaving Edward with a look of puzzlement as he attempts to decipher the perplexing advice he has just received. From our elevated vantage point, we shift our gaze from the road to behold Edward and Karl walking away from Ashton, each carrying a backpack filled with all their worldly possessions. The two travelers reach a juncture where the paved road gracefully curves to the left, while a dense, overgrown dirt road stretches straight ahead, ominously marked with signs and warnings of potential danger that lies ahead.

Karl eyes the dirt road with a sense of wariness, a hint of paranoia etched on his features, yet his spirits seem to lift, even as he accepts the heavier burden that may come. Although the road appears heavily overgrown and slightly foreboding, it is not entirely sinister, as the sunlight continues to shine brightly and birds persist in chirping their melodious tunes. As the road narrows to a rough and rugged path, beams of sunlight break through the dense canopy of trees above, illuminating the air in which particles dance whimsically. As they round a bend, Karl's voice lowers in pitch when he encounters thick, thorny vines sprawling across the path, causing him to halt abruptly, as he acutely senses the sudden absence of birdsong, and an eerie silence descends upon the forest. He glances back in the direction from which they came, but Edward encourages him to move forward, gingerly navigating through the thorny obstacles. In a dramatic moment, a cawing crow swoops down suddenly, seizing the hat from Karl's grasp. Undeterred, Edward discards the sign and boldly ventures into the web of spider webs that lie ahead.

Emerging triumphantly from the dense forest, Edward brushes away the lingering remnants of cobwebs and shakes off the spiders clinging stubbornly to his shirt, with one particularly persistent spider lodged in his sleeve, prompting an animated dance to dislodge it. Despite his best efforts, he continues to twitch, convinced that yet another spider remains hidden. At his feet, a gravel road welcomes him back, smooth and dusty, offering a comforting sense of reassurance and familiarity.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As we glide smoothly behind them, our gaze falls upon Ashton, a diminutive town nestled snugly within a tiny valley. Karl, standing nearby, initially greets the sight with a smile that slowly transforms, fading into a shadowed expression marked by a hint of sad suspicion. He pauses, his thoughts momentarily halted, before extending his hand to seal an agreement with a firm shake. In a seamless, flowing sequence, Karl takes a pair of hedge clippers in his hands and carefully trims his own hair, each snip deliberate yet swift. Simultaneously, Edward deftly slices a surplus army tent into pieces, his hands skillfully transforming it into a makeshift shirt for Karl. The high school marching band's spirited tunes elevate the atmosphere, and the enthusiastic citizens of Ashton assemble, their collective spirits buoyed, to bid farewell to Edward and Karl. Amongst the familiar faces, a few tears are shed, mingling with the joy of the occasion. Edward bends slightly, accommodating the Mayor's gesture as the key is carefully placed around his neck, sparking a wave of cheers from the gathered crowd. Seizing this moment, Edward and Karl embark on their journey, their hands waving in acknowledgment as they move away, with Don Price, nonchalantly smoking at the corner, remaining the lone figure untroubled by Edward's departure. As the pair advances, numerous townsfolk spill onto the street, their arms opening in warm embraces or extending to shake Edward’s hand in heartfelt farewells. Gradually, as the crowd gives way, Edward finds himself standing directly before an unnamed individual. The surrounding clamors subside, miraculously hushed as though enveloped by an otherworldly spell, and she gestures subtly for Edward to lean in closer, her lips poised to impart secretive words. Despite our proximity, her whispered advice evades our ears, shrouding Edward in a veil of confusion. With a graceful sweep upward, our view transitions from the road, unveiling Edward and Karl as they stride out of Ashton, each man burdened only by a backpack laden with his worldly possessions. Approaching a fork in the path, they encounter a junction where the paved road gently sweeps leftward, contrasting with an overgrown dirt road that continues straight, emblazoned with signs and ominous warnings of peril. Karl's gaze shifts toward this dirt path, his demeanor cautious, tinged with paranoia, yet he steels himself, aware it entails additional burdens to bear. The road, though overgrown, lacks an inherently sinister aura, the bright sun still shining and birds joyously chirping overhead. As the road constricts into a rugged trail, beams of sunlight pierce through a dense canopy, capturing and illuminating tiny particles suspended in the air. Rounding a sudden bend, Karl's voice falters, sinking in pitch as his eyes meet thick, thorn-draped vines barricading the way. He halts, acutely aware for the first time of the profound silence, as though the forest itself has drawn a breathless pause. Casting a backward glance along his path of entry, he hesitates, yet Edward, with resolve undeterred, advances, navigating cautiously through the menacing thorns. At this moment, a crow swoops down, its wings casting shadows as it deftly snatches the hat from Edward's grasp. In frustration, Edward discards the sign and resolutely charges forward, plunging into a web of spider threads. Soon, Edward reemerges from the oppressive embrace of the forest, diligently brushing away the lingering cobwebs and energetically shaking stubborn spiders from his clothes. Despite ridding himself of the visible pests, a lingering suspicion of hidden ones keeps him twitching nervously. Underfoot, the soothing texture of the gravel road reappears, once more smooth, dusty, and reassuringly familiar.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: As we circle behind them, we view Ashton, a small town nestled in a tiny valley, where Karl smiles briefly before his expression shifts to suspicion. After a moment of thought, Karl agrees with a handshake. In one shot, Karl trims his hair with hedge clippers while Edward repurposes a surplus army tent into a shirt. With spirits lifted by the high school marching band, Ashton’s citizens gather to bid farewell to Edward and Karl, shedding a few tears among familiar faces. Edward ducks to allow the Mayor to place a key around his neck, prompting cheers from the crowd. As they begin their journey, waving goodbye, only Don Price, standing on the corner, is unsentimental about Edward’s departure. Many townsfolk step forward to hug or shake hands with Edward. As the crowd parts, he encounters an unnamed person who silently gestures for him to lean down. She whispers something inaudible to us, leaving Edward puzzled. We tilt up to reveal Edward and Karl walking out of Ashton, each carrying a backpack filled with their belongings. They reach a junction where the paved road bends left while an overgrown dirt road stretches ahead, marked with signs of danger. Karl regards the dirt road warily but agrees to continue despite the extra load. The sunlit, bird-filled road narrows to a rough path, with streaks of sunlight piercing the thick canopy. As they round a bend, Karl's mood shifts when he sees thorny vines blocking the path, and he halts, noticing the sudden quiet of the forest. He hesitates, but Edward moves forward, navigating through the thorns. A crow unexpectedly swoops down, snatching the hat from his hands. Undeterred, Edward discards the sign and proceeds through the spiderwebs. Emerging from the forest, he brushes off cobwebs and shakes out spiders, performing a brief dance to free one from his sleeve, still twitching at the thought of more. At his feet, the gravel road reappears, smooth, dusty, and reassuring.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: As we circle behind them, we look down at Ashton, a tiny town in a tiny valley nestled in the Appalachian Mountains, where Karl smiles, but then it fades into a certain sad suspicion. Karl, who is known for his cautious nature, thinks for a moment, then they shake on it. In a single shot, Karl cuts his hair with hedge clippers, an unusual choice that reflects his resourcefulness, while Edward cuts up a surplus army tent, a remnant from World War II supplies, to make him a shirt. Spirits buoyed by the high school marching band, a tradition dating back to the town's founding in the early 20th century, all the good citizens of Ashton are gathered to see off Edward and Karl, with a few tears amid the familiar faces. Edward ducks a bit so the Mayor, who has been in office for nearly two decades, can put the key around his neck, and the crowd cheers. With that, Edward and Karl start walking, waving as they go, with only Don Price, the town troublemaker known for his perpetual scowl, smoking on the corner, not sad to see Edward leave. Many townsfolk come onto the street to hug Edward or shake his hand. As the crowd parts, he finds himself face to face with an unnamed person, a mysterious figure who rarely appears in public. The ruckus slows and quiets, as if a strange spell has been cast, and she motions for Edward to lean down so she can whisper something to him. Although we're very close, we can't hear her voice, and the advice only succeeds in confusing Edward. We tilt up from the road to reveal Edward and Karl walking out of Ashton, each wearing a backpack with all his earthly possessions, a symbol of their commitment to starting anew. Edward and Karl come to a bend where the paved road veers left, and an overgrown dirt road, rumored to be haunted due to local legends of an old witch's residence, runs straight, blocked with signs and warnings of danger. Karl looks at the dirt road, wary and a little paranoid, but perks up even though it means more for him to carry, driven by a sense of adventure that defies his cautious nature. The road is overgrown but not altogether creepy, with the sun still shining and the birds still chirping, reminiscent of a forgotten world. The road narrows to a rough path, with spikes of sunlight breaking through the thick canopy, catching particles in the air that glimmer like tiny stars. Coming around a bend, his pitch drops as he sees thick, thorny vines reminiscent of the ones described in local folklore growing across the path, and he stops, realizing for the first time that the birds have stopped singing, and the forest is dead quiet. He looks back the way he came, but Edward presses on, carefully stepping through the thorns. Just then, a cawing crow, often seen as an omen in folklore, swoops down and grabs the hat right out of his hands. Edward tosses the sign, marked with warnings from a bygone era, and forges ahead into the spiderwebs. Edward emerges from the forest, brushing the last cobwebs off and shaking the spiders from his shirt, with one stuck in his sleeve, requiring him to dance to get it out, as though performing a jester's jig. Even then, he keeps twitching, convinced another one is left behind. At his feet, the gravel road has returned, smooth and dusty and comforting, leading them back to familiar territory.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. Edward and Karl come to a bend where the paved road veers left and an overgrown dirt road runs straight blocked with signs and warnings of danger. Karl looks at the dirt road wary and a little paranoid but perks up even though it means more for him to carry. The road is overgrown but not altogether creepy with the sun still shining and the birds still chirping. The road narrows to a rough path with spikes of sunlight breaking through the thick canopy catching particles in the air. Coming around a bend his pitch drops as he sees thick thorny vines growing across the path and he stops realizing for the first time that the birds have stopped singing and the forest is dead quiet. He looks back the way he came but Edward presses on carefully stepping through the thorns. Just then a cawing crow swoops down and grabs the hat right out of his hands. Edward tosses the sign and forges ahead into the spiderwebs. Edward emerges from the forest brushing the last cobwebs off and shaking the spiders from his shirt with one stuck in his sleeve requiring him to dance to get it out. Even then he keeps twitching. convinced another one is left behind. At his feet the gravel road has returned smooth and dusty and comforting.

On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Edward and Karl come to a bend where the paved road veers left and an overgrown dirt road runs straight blocked with signs and warnings of danger. Karl looks at the dirt road wary and a little paranoid but perks up even though it means more for him to carry. The road is overgrown but not altogether creepy with the sun still shining and the birds still chirping. The road narrows to a rough path with spikes of sunlight breaking through the thick canopy catching particles in the air. Coming around a bend his pitch drops as he sees thick thorny vines growing across the path and he stops realizing for the first time that the birds have stopped singing and the forest is dead quiet. He looks back the way he came but Edward presses on carefully stepping through the thorns. Just then a cawing crow swoops down and grabs the hat right out of his hands. Edward tosses the sign and forges ahead into the spiderwebs. Edward emerges from the forest brushing the last cobwebs off and shaking the spiders from his shirt with one stuck in his sleeve requiring him to dance to get it out. Even then he keeps twitching. convinced another one is left behind. At his feet the gravel road has returned smooth and dusty and comforting.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: As we circle behind them we look down at Ashton a tiny town in a tiny valley where Karl smiles but then it fades into a certain sad suspicion. Karl thinks for a moment then they shake on it. In a single shot Karl cuts his hair with hedge clippers while Edward cuts up a surplus army tent to make him a shirt. Spirits buoyed by the high school marching band. all the good citizens of Ashton are gathered to see off Edward and Karl with a few tears amid the familiar faces. Edward ducks a bit so the Mayor can put the key around his neck and the crowd cheers. Just then a cawing crow swoops down and grabs the hat right out of his hands. Edward tosses the sign and forges ahead into the spiderwebs. Edward emerges from the forest brushing the last cobwebs off and shaking the spiders from his shirt with one stuck in his sleeve requiring him to dance to get it out. Even then he keeps twitching. convinced another one is left behind. At his feet the gravel road has returned smooth and dusty and comforting.

Karl thinks for a moment then they shake on it. In a single shot Karl cuts his hair with hedge clippers while Edward cuts up a surplus army tent to make him a shirt. convinced another one is left behind. At his feet the gravel road has returned smooth and dusty and comforting.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: As we drift above them, we gaze up at Baxter, a sprawling city in a sprawling field, where Greta frowns, but then it transforms into a certain joyful curiosity. Greta ponders for a moment, then they dance on it. In a single frame, Greta grows her nails with garden shears while Olivia paints a vintage barber chair to make her a jacket. Spirits dampened by the college choir, all the ill-tempered dogs of Baxter are gathered to greet Olivia and Greta, with a few smiles amid the unknown creatures. Olivia bends a bit so the Librarian can place the bracelet around her wrist, and the animals howl. With that, Olivia and Greta begin driving, clapping as they leave, with only Sam Finch, juggling on the roof, thrilled to see Olivia arrive. Several cats leap onto the sidewalk to nuzzle Olivia or pat her back. As the animals disperse, she finds herself face to face with an unnamed creature. The chaos intensifies and echoes, as if a familiar curse has been lifted, and it gestures for Olivia to kneel up so it can shout something at her. Although we're very distant, we can't see its gesture, and the message only succeeds in delighting Olivia. We pan down from the sky to reveal Olivia and Greta driving into Baxter, each wearing a satchel with all her heavenly dreams. Olivia and Greta come to a crossroads where the gravel path swerves right, and a mysterious asphalt path runs crooked, adorned with banners and clues of mystery. Greta peers at the asphalt path, eager and a little expectant, but sighs even though it means less for her to underestimate. The path is mysterious but not altogether eerie, with the moon still glowing and the stars still twinkling. The path widens into a smooth lane, with bursts of starlight sifting through the thin mist, capturing shadows in the sky. Coming around a turn, her voice rises as she hears small, melodic streams flowing across the lane, and she pauses, realizing for the last time that the stars have started twinkling, and the universe is alive and buzzing. She peers ahead the way she came, but Olivia pulls back, haphazardly leaping through the streams. Just then, a screeching bat dives up and drops the lantern right into her arms. Olivia catches the flag and retreats backward through the cobwebs. Olivia delves into the field, swiping the last threads off and tapping the fireflies from her coat, with one lodged in her pocket, requiring her to shimmy to let it fly. Even then, she keeps swaying, convinced another one is flying beside. At her head, the wooden bridge has vanished, slick and misty and confusing.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: As we circle behind them, we look down at Ashton, a tiny town in a small valley, where Karl smiles before a sad suspicion appears. He thinks for a moment and then shakes on it. In one shot, Karl trims his hair with hedge clippers while Edward cuts a surplus army tent to make a shirt. The citizens gather to bid Edward and Karl farewell, the high school marching band lifting spirits. The Mayor places a key around Edward’s neck as the crowd cheers, though Don Price isn’t sad to see Edward go. Townsfolk hug Edward or shake his hand, and an unnamed person whispers something to him, confusing him. As Edward and Karl leave Ashton, each with a backpack, they face a fork where the paved road veers left and an overgrown dirt road goes straight, marked with danger signs. Karl looks wary but carries on. The dirt road narrows into a path with sunlight filtering through a thick canopy. Karl stops at thick vines, noticing the silence, but Edward moves ahead carefully. A crow swoops down to snatch his hat as Edward pushes through. Emerging from the forest, Edward brushes cobwebs off, shaking spiders from his shirt, twitching to ensure none remain. He stands on the smooth, dusty gravel road, comforted.
